Description: Fragment from neck of Attic black-figured pottery amphora; moulding at turn to shoulder. Interior glazed; exterior, seated sphinx to right, facing a draped male (front part of lower body remaining).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Also published by G. Bakir, Sophilos (1981), pl. 65, fig. 127 and LIMC VIII pl. 806, Sphinx 193. Beazley argued (CVA p. 93) that the male in the short chiton should be Hermes.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (IIIH pl. 1, 37)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0878)
Exhibition history: On loan to Classics Centre in Oxford. Previous location: AN Bothmer Cabinet 58.6 Attic Black-Figure
